definition: Chechnya, a republic in southwestern Russia/Chechen
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131

sentences.english: Only recently has Russia tamed Chechnya.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯最近才馴服車臣。

sentences.english: However, the Chechens who were allied to the Afghan Taliban had been more polite.
sentences.chinese: 然而，與阿富汗塔利班人結盟的車臣人則禮貌得多。

sentences.english: The unit of Yekaterinburg lost a lot of men there.
sentences.chinese: 在車臣戰爭中，駐葉卡捷琳堡的這隻部隊損失慘重。

sentences.english: In April the Kremlin cancelled its counter-terrorist regime in Chechnya.
sentences.chinese: 今年4月，克里姆林宮取消了在車臣的官方反恐機構。

sentences.english: In Oxford she managed to escape the horrors of Chechnya.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏，她成功地逃脫了車臣恐怖的威脅。

sentences.english: Her kidnappers headed in the direction of Ingushetia, Chechnya's neighbouring republic.
sentences.chinese: 綁架者們朝着印古什，車臣的鄰接共和國飛馳。

sentences.english: Ya Shaer said he believes the three bodyguards have been killed in Chechnya.
sentences.chinese: 雅沙爾稱，他相信那三個車臣保鏢都已死亡。

sentences.english: Chechens gesture and wave a Chechen flag during a demonstration against drug abuse in the capital Grozny March 16, 2006.
sentences.chinese: 車臣人在反藥物濫用的遊行中比出手勢並揮舞國旗。

sentences.english: He's hired a bunch of Chechens.
Mr Yamadayev had fallen out with Chechnya's president, Ramzan Kadyrov.
sentences.chinese: 此前亞瑪迪耶夫已經與車臣總統卡德羅夫鬧翻。

definition: 38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
East Turkestan Liberation Organization (ETLO), Chinese dissident group/abbr. for 東突厥斯坦解放組織|东突厥斯坦解放组织
to evacuate (e.g. foreign civilians from a war zone)
Marshal Josip Broz Tito (1892-1980), Yugoslav military and communist political leader, president of Yugoslavia 1945-1980
